phrasetype.phrase: Allow HTML (this will only include HTML if the setting in the forum is also on).

({2}: {3})

({2}: {3})

The widget will be removed from all of your pages, along with any associated data.

This action cannot be undone.
Can Use HTML in CMS Content
Sorry, but I cannot delete a section that contains content. If you want to delete this, please first delete any content it contains.
You cannot move a parent node to a subnode. That would cause serious database corruption.
I found some nodes that were not properly placed. Please check the section Lost and Found and move them to the correct section.
2. Choose a category to create sub-categories
Choose and set Display Order for Sections to appear in Navbar
Click on Section to view/edit permissions
Please confirm- are you sure you want to permanently delete this item?

Flattening a grid will no longer allow you to modify the grid via the wizard. You will now be working directly with the grid HTML.

Are you sure?
There appears to be updated information on this page. Would you like me to save now?

Unflattening a grid will reset the grid to the default HTML that was generated by the wizard. This will also reset the default template HTML.

Are You Sure?
Default Template HTML<dfn>This is the HTML that is used by the CMS on the front end. Widgetlist locations should match those in the Layout Manager UI HTML.</dfn>
Do not use the following input field names in widget html: xyz_modified, xyz_widgetid, xyz_column, xyz_widgetinstanceid, xyz_isprimary, xyz_editorialid, xyz_removedprimary
Enter a list of blog post ids you would like to track. You can enter multiple ids separated by commas. They will be verified upon saving.
Enter user names for users whose blog comments you want to track. You can enter multiple names separated by commas. The names will be verified upon saving.
Enter user names for users whose posts you want to track. You can enter multiple names separated by commas. The names will be verified upon saving.
Enter categories. You can enter multiple categories, separated by commas. The categories will be validated when you save.
Enter Php Code, in the form "$output = <your code>"
Enter tags. You can enter multiple tags, separated by commas. The tags will be validated when you save.
Enter user names. You can enter multiple names separated by commas. The names will be validated when you save.
Expand the entire Sections tree if you have less than this many items in the tree

The following error occurred when attempting to evaluate the grid specified for this layout:
{1}
This is likely caused by a malformed conditional statement. You must correct this error before this grid can be used for a layout.

The data you passed was invalid or internally inconsistent. If you are certain the data you submitted was correct, please contact vBulletin technical and submit a support ticket, including as much information as possible about what you did to cause this message.
Layout Manager UI HTML<dfn>This is the HTML that is used within the Layout Manager for placing widgets on the layout.</dfn>
Click on a section to see only its categories
You can only assign up to {1} items to a section home page. Please choose a lower number.
Javascript expands to show all sections
Please enter a title for this category
Please select a section or category.
A unique URL alias is required.
There are no categories in this section
You do not have permission to create content here. If you believe you received this message in error, please contact your administrator.
You do not have rights to edit this content. If you think you should, please contact your system administrator to assign the correct rights.
The content of the page in raw HTML goes here.
Permissions not assigned for section {1}
1. Categories must belong to a section. Choose a Section
Please enter a title for this layout
Please specify at least one widget
The preview text goes here. If you don't enter anything here, the pagetext will be stripped of html and the beginning will be used.
This should be well-formed HTML. A good callout would be something like <img title="My Image" alt="My Image" src="http://www.somewhere.com/images/1.png" class="cms_article_preview_image">
Checking this button allows the preview to be displayed even if the user does not have rights to view the article
Saved count of items per page.
Secondary Footer <dfn>This appears above your footer template.</dfn>
Secondary Header <dfn>This appears below your header template.</dfn>
This affects display of title, author, published date, update date, page views and full display in section page settings. All of these settings have default value 'Yes'.
large performance enhancement for large numbers of articles

This page allows you to control the priority setting in your XML sitemap on a section-by-section basis. Setting a value for a section will change that section's priority setting as well as the articles within that section. While you should set important sections to a higher priority, you should not set a high priority on too much content. The default value is {1}.
This SEO URL Alias is already in use. Please select a new one.
You need javascript to properly view and access this page. Please enable javascript. If your browser does not have javascript we recommend you download and install one which does.

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Global
phrasetype.phrase: This page allows you to control the priority setting in your XML sitemap on a section-by-section basis. Setting a value for a section will change that section's priority setting as well as the articles within that section. While you should set important sections to a higher priority, you should not set a high priority on too much content.

phrasetype.name: Control Panel Help Text
phrasetype.phrase: If set, this will cause the CMS to use the stored thumbnail for any article preview images that are local attachments. Preview images that are not local attachments will not be affected. Note that both thumbnail creation and the display of thumbnails must be enabled (in the message attachment options) for this setting to have any effect.

If set, this will cause the CMS to display inline images full size, overriding the option to display them as thumbnails in the main attachment settings, this was the default behavior prior to this setting being added. Turning this override off will allow them to display as thumbnails if you choose to.

This feature requires that the "Always use Forum URL as Base Path" be set to yes.

This will override the main Forum URL setting for CMS pages to allow the CMS pages to be accessed from a different directory than the rest of vBulletin. This value can either be an absolute URL in which case it fully overrides the Forum URL or it can be a relative URL, in which case it is appended to Forum URL.

For example, if vBulletin is located at http://example.com/vbulletin then entering a value of "cms" will result in the CMS being located at http://example.com/vbulletin/cms. A value of "http://www.example.com/cms" will result in the CMS being located at http://www.example.com/cms. All vBulletin URLs must have the same host name.

In addition to setting the CMS Component URL, you will need to take the following steps in order for the CMS to work in the new location.

  1. If you are locating the CMS in a directory other than a direct subdirectory of the vBulletin directory (http://example.com/vbulletin/cms in the above example), then edit cms/vb_dir.php in the do_not_upload directory of your download package to set the vBulletin install directory. Instructions are given in that file.
  2. Upload the CMS files directory from the do_not_upload directory to the directory you want the CMS to be located in. If you want the CMS to be in http://example.com/vbulletin/mycms, create a subdirectory in your vBulletin directory called mycms and upload the CMS files there.
  3. If you are using rewrite friendly URLs, you will need to copy the .htaccess file from do_not_upload/rewrite/apache2/cms to the stub directory before uploading.
  4. If you are using a different domain, such as cms.example.com versus www.example.com then you will need a crossdomain.xml file for the asset manager flash upload. Create a file called "crossdomain.xml" and place it in your cms subdirectory with the following contents modified to suit your domain.
    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <cross-domain-policy xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://www.adobe.com/xml/schemas/PolicyFile.xsd"> <allow-access-from domain="*.example.com"/> <site-control permitted-cross-domain-policies="master-only"/> <allow-http-request-headers-from domain="*.example.com" headers="*" secure="true"/> </cross-domain-policy>

If the cookie path option is set for the site, it needs to be general enough to include all vBulletin URLs. For example, if vBulletin is located at www.host.com/mysite/vbulletin but the cms is located at www.mysite.com/mysite/cms then a cookie path of "mysite" will work, but a cookie path of "mysite/vbulletin" will not work because the cookies will not be sent to pages in the mysite/cms directory.

phrasetype.name: Scheduled Tasks
phrasetype.phrase: Perform hourly cleanup tasks for the vB CMS

phrasetype.name: Email Body Text
phrasetype.phrase:
$reportinfo[rusername] ( mailto:$bbuserinfo[email] ) has reported this article comment:
$reportinfo[itemlink]#post$reportinfo[postid]
This is part of this article: $reportinfo[entrytitle] $reportinfo[itemlink]
This is the reason that the user gave: $reportinfo[reason]
$reportinfo[discuss]
This message has been sent to all moderators of this article, or all administrators if there are no moderators.
Please respond to this comment as applicable.

[url=$reportinfo[reporterlink]]$reportinfo[rusername][/url] has reported an article comment.
Reason:[quote]$reportinfo[reason][/quote] Article Comment: [url=$reportinfo[itemlink]#post$reportinfo[postid]]$reportinfo[entrytitle][/url] Assigned Moderators: $reportinfo[modlist]
Posted by: [url=$reportinfo[posterlink]]$reportinfo[pusername][/url] Original Content: [quote]$reportinfo[pagetext][/quote]

phrasetype.name: Error Messages
phrasetype.phrase: According to our records you have already voted. Changing votes is not allowed.
You cannot add navigation elements to the CMS using the Navigation Manager, it has its own system for displaying links.
The grid can not be deleted because it is currently being used by a layout. If you want to delete the grid, configure existing layouts that are using the grid to use a different grid.

Could not discern a proper list of widget locations in the Layout Editor UI HTML.
Widget locations need to be in the following format:

<ul class="list_no_decoration" id="widgetlist_column1">$column[1]</ul>

The location may appear any where in the HTML but the first location must start with 1, with each successive column increasing by one, for example:

<ul class="list_no_decoration" id="widgetlist_column1">$column[1]</ul>
<ul class="list_no_decoration" id="widgetlist_column1">$column[2]</ul>
<ul class="list_no_decoration" id="widgetlist_column1">$column[3]</ul>
<ul class="list_no_decoration" id="widgetlist_column1">$column[4]</ul>
<ul class="list_no_decoration" id="widgetlist_column1">$column[5]</ul>

Could not discern a proper list of widget locations in the Default Template HTML.
Widget locations need to be in the following format:

$column[1]

The location may appear any where in the HTML but the first location must start with 1, with each successive column increasing by one, for example:

$column[1]
$column[2]
$column[3]
$column[4]
$column[5]
An existing grid is already using the specified title.
You have requested a widget configuration that has not been defined.
This layout can not be deleted as it is currently being used by pages.
The number of widget locations in the Layout UI HTML ({1}) does not match the number of widget locations in the Default Template HTML ({2}).

Cannot proceed as no CMS root node could be found.

This is a fatal error that should never occur unless your node table is broken or corrupted. You may need to reinstall the CMS.
No CMS categories have been defined yet.
There are no grids to download
No valid widgets were specified for this layout.
There is no content to display.
This SEO URL Alias is already in use. Please select a new one.
The url segment that you have entered is too long ({1} characters). Please shorten it to {2} characters long.
Too long ({1} characters). Please shorten to {2} characters long.
The widget varname {1} is already in use by another widget.

phrasetype.name: FAQ Text
phrasetype.phrase:
vBulletin allows you to create a special access section that only a select group of users can view. Users who are not in the group can't normally view the articles in the section. But, when the preview option is selected, it allows these users to get a sneak peak of the article.

NOTE: The preview option must be selected in the section options as well.

1. Either create a new article or edit an existing one.
  2. Select the "Yes" radio button to the right of the "Previews" header.
  3. Click the Save button.

Note: Users can see the public preview even if they do not have permission to see the article.

Tags are a method of categorizing articles on the site. They make them easily searchable by keywords and you can list articles with similar tags. Here are the instructions on how to add tags to your articles:

  1. Login to your account.
  2. Navigate to the article you want to edit.
  3. Hover over the article header. A pencil icon will appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. Click on the Edit Tags icon and add tags. Separate multiple tags with a comma.
  6. Click on the Save button.

If you have been given permission to create new content in a CMS Section, there will be a "Create New Article" button in the top right corner of the screen. Press this button to load the Article Editor.

Right now there isn't a way to save a rough draft of your article. But, you can use the Publishing Date and Publishing Time fields in the article form to delay the date the article is published to the public. This will give you time to go back to change and revise your article before it appears in its assigned section.

Articles are edited in the user-facing side of your site much the same way as Sections are edited in the CMS. Follow the steps below to edit existing articles.
  1. Login to your account.
  2. Navigate to the article you want to edit.
  3. Hover over the article header. A pencil icon will appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the article editor, change the fields you want.
  6. Click on the Save button.

An article can only belong to one section. But, you can make an article appear in a parent section by changing the "Display Order" for the section to either "Newest_first" or "Newest Per Section". The "Newest_first" option will cause the latest articles published in both the section and subsection to display on the section page. The "Newest Per Section" option displays the newest articles in each sub-section in the parent section page. Please see How do I change the Content Display Order for a Section? for more information.

vBulletin's CMS tools allows you to control when and where an article is published on your site. If you don't see your article in the section immediately, you should do the following:

  • Check to see if you are in the right section.
  • Check to see if the permissions for the section have been set so that only a certain group of users can see the section. If it is, the article will not be made visible to the general public unless the "preview" option was selected at creation.
  • Check to see if your article has been published.
  • Check to see if the "Start Publishing" date was set to either a date before today or today's date.

1. Click on the Home tab if you are not already in the vBulletin CMS portion of the site.
  2. Navigate to the section you want to change.
  3. Hover over the header. A pencil icon should appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the section editor, select the content layout you want from the "Content Layout" dropdown list.
  6. Click the button.

The vBulletin CMS allows you and your users to create, edit and publish articles directly to your site. It combines a simple to use content manager with a unique organizational system that lets you control the smallest detail of the site from the number of sections, to the overall layout, to the placement of widgets and displays on each page.
In the "Publishing Options" section, go to the "Categories" header. Check the checkboxes for the categories you want to assign to the article.

A category is an admin level tag. This means that only users with administrative rights or write access can assign articles to categories while readers can not.

Categories make it possible to group articles in different sections in one location. Unlike sections, an article can be assigned to more then one category. This allows you to filter, group and even search content in a section.

You can either do this when you first create the article or at a later time by editing the options for an article.
To create a new section, you need to have access to the Admin Control Panel. Once logged into the Admin Control Panel go to vBulletin CMS -> Section Manager in the left navigation.

1. Click on the HOME tab if you are not already in the vBulletin CMS section.
  2. Navigate to the section you want to change the "Content Display Order" for.
  3. Hover over the header. A pencil icon should appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the section editor, select the option you desire from the "Display Order" dropdown list found in the "Section Information" section of the form.
  6. Click .

1. Click on the Home tab if you are not already in the vBulletin CMS portion of the site.
  2. Navigate to the section you want to change the layout for.
  3. Hover over the header. A pencil icon should appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the section editor, select a new layout from the "Section Layout" dropdown list.
  6. Click the button.

1. Click on the Home tab if you are not already in the vBulletin CMS section.
  2. Navigate to the section you want to change.
  3. Hover over the header. A pencil icon should appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the section editor, enter the number of articles you wish to display in the "Per Page" textbox.
  6. Click the button.

You can rename a section in the user visible site portion of your vBulletin community if you have the proper permissions.
  1. Click on the HOME tab if you are not already in the vBulletin CMS section.
  2. Navigate to the section you want to edit the name of.
  3. Hover over the header. A pencil icon should appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the section editor, clear the "Name:" text box in the "Section Information" section.
  6. Enter the new name for the section in the clear text box.
  7. Update the SEO URL Alias and HTML Title Fields as necessary
  8. Click Save

1. Click on the Home tab if you are not already in the vBulletin CMS portion of the site.
  2. Navigate to the section you want to change the style for.
  3. Hover over the header. A pencil icon should appear.
  4. Click on the pencil icon.
  5. In the section editor, select a new style from the "Style" dropdown list.
  6. Click the button.

The style controls how a section looks from the font size to the background color. The layout controls where each element (ex: navigation bar, article list, links, and feeds) is placed. Lastly, the content layout controls how articles are organized within a section.

phrasetype.name: GLOBAL
phrasetype.phrase: You can view the page at [url={1}]{1}[/url]

phrasetype.name: Style Tools
phrasetype.phrase: This stylevar controls the background of CMS content.
This stylevar controls the font of titles in CMS content previews.
This stylevar controls the border of CMS content preview images.
This stylevar controls the margin of CMS content preview images.
This stylevar controls the outer line of CMS content preview images.
CMS Content Preview Image Outer Line
This stylevar controls the maximum size of video in CMS content previews.
CMS Content Preview Video Maximum Size
This stylevar controls the background of the CMS body. The body is the area below the header, which contains all other elements.
This stylevar controls the font of days in the CMS calendar widget.
This stylevar controls the background of the month navigation in the CMS calendar widget.
CMS Calendar Widget Month Navigation Background
This stylevar controls the font of the month navigation in the CMS calendar widget.
CMS Calendar Widget Month Navigation Font
This stylevar controls the background of week days in the CMS calendar widget.
CMS Calendar Widget Week Day Background
This stylevar controls the border of week days in the CMS calendar widget.
CMS Calendar Widget Week Day Border
This stylevar controls the font of week days in the CMS calendar widget.
CMS Calendar Widget Week Day Font
This stylevar controls the line between different CMS content in CMS content lists.
This stylevar controls the bottom border of CMS content headers.
This stylevar controls the top border of CMS content headers.
This stylevar controls the text color of CMS content headers.
This stylevar controls the font of CMS content headers.
This stylevar controls the margin of CMS content headers.
This stylevar controls the padding of CMS content headers.
This stylevar controls the background of rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
This stylevar controls the inner top border of rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
CMS Navigation Widget Row Inner Top Border
This stylevar controls the border of rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
This stylevar controls the text color of rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
CMS Navigation Widget Row Text Color
This stylevar controls the font of rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
This stylevar controls the background of hover rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
CMS Navigation Widget Hover Row Background
This stylevar controls the inner top border of hover rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
CMS Navigation Widget Hover Row Inner Top Border
This stylevar controls the border of hover rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
CMS Navigation Widget Hover Row Border
This stylevar controls the text color of hover rows in the CMS navigation widgets.
CMS Navigation Widget Hover Row Text Color
This stylevar controls the padding of CMS widgets.
This stylevar controls the padding of CMS widget headers.
This stylevar controls the margin of CMS widgets.

phrasetype.name: Forum Blocks Settings
phrasetype.phrase: You can choose to display articles in specific categories.
This is the maximum number of articles that will display in the block.
This setting allows you to specify how many characters of the article preview text to display in the block.
You can choose to display articles in specific sections.

Choose which article type do you want to display:
New Started - Newly published articles will display first
New Replied - Newly commented articles will displayed first
Most Replied - Articles with most comments will display first
Most Viewed - Articles with most views will display first

phrasetype.name: Content Management System
phrasetype.phrase: You have already rated this article
The stream may be filtered to display items from specific sections. The blog option requires that product to be installed.
Set how many days of activity to query. If you have a big board, setting it to a lower number will improve its performance.
This controls the sort order of the stream. The stream may be sorted by newest items or by most popular items.
Be aware of the relationship between fields. For example, prefixes are only for threads/posts. If you select Visitor Messages and any prefix, you will never get results. So test your searches!
The category {2} is not published
Your comment has been posted. You can refresh the page to see it.
Are you sure you wish to delete this page? Deleting the page will remove any configuration associated with it and may also delete any content created for the page.
Enter a list of thread ids, comma-separated, to show. This will override the other settings
For some reason I find the node has not been set. If you were not doing something abnormal, please contact the administrator and describe how you got this message.
Maximum number of items that will display
Maximum number of polls to show
Maximum number of records to show
A title is required for the article.
Please enter a title for this section
You need to enter a title for the Section
A unique URL alias is required.
There are no articles in this section

There is no available content in section {1}

Oldest poll to show, in days

This article was originally published in blog:
Sections to Display in Navbar Sub-Menu

Use RSS title as the widget title

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Set this to yes to switch the article previews to use image thumbnails rather than resizing the full images. Thumbnails must be enabled for this option to have any effect.
Name of your CMS. This appears in the title of every CMS page.
This will be used for preview text length if you do not specify a preview break.

If a user visits your CMS site without specifying a page, they will view this page. It should consist of the page number, dash, then the seo url you assigned that page. For example: '1-home-page'. An incorrect value here can prevent CMS from functioning.
The URL used by the CMS Tab in the main navigation menu. This setting should never be left blank.
When set, this overrides the display of inline images as thumbnails in the CMS, they will be shown fullsize, regardless of the attachment options setting.

Optional URL for your CMS.

If this is specified it will override the Forum URL setting for CMS pages. You may specify an absolute URL or a URL relative to your Forum URL

Examples:
http://cms.example.com
http://www.example.com
http://www.example.com/cms
cms

The URL should not have a trailing slash or contain the special directories ../ or ./

Note: If you change the CMS URL you must upload the CMS stub directory. See help for further information.
The forum to use for CMS item comment threads. Note, if you change this value to a different Forum then you will need to manually move any existing threads to the new forum.

setting.validationcode: $url = @parse_url($data); return ($url['path'] OR $url['host']) ? true : 'Please enter a valid URL';
